meanings.definition: The act of causing something to become crocked or cracked.
meanings.sent1: The crocking of the vase happened when it fell off the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The crocking on the old wall showed its age and wear.
meanings.sent3: The crocking on the sidewalk made it look like a puzzle waiting to be solved.
meanings.sent4: The crocking on the mirror reflected the passage of time.
meanings.sent5: The crocking on the pottery added character and charm.

meanings.definition: The process of forming cracks or lines on a surface.
meanings.sent1: The crocking on the pavement was caused by the tree roots underneath.
meanings.sent2: The crocking on the ceiling was a result of water damage.
meanings.sent3: The crocking on the sidewalk looked like a map of a tiny city.
meanings.sent4: The crocking on the glass resembled lightning striking the surface.
meanings.sent5: The crocking on the painting gave it a unique texture.

meanings.definition: The action of producing a crocking sound.
meanings.sent1: The sudden crocking startled the birds in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The continuous crocking in the distance was coming from the old windmill.
meanings.sent3: The rhythmic crocking made the room feel cozy and familiar.
meanings.sent4: The mysterious crocking in the attic kept the children intrigued.
meanings.sent5: The loud crocking echoed through the empty hallway.
